c:
In my harbor there were two ships,
One weathered and steady, a companion through storms,
The other bright and new, bringing promises of distant shores.

Each vessel cast its own anchor,
Their chains crossing beneath the surface,
Creating invisible tensions in the murky depths.

I was the lighthouse keeper,
Trying to guide them both safely home
Through the fog of mistrust and whispered waves.

But the tide of jealousy rose,
And the older ship lifted its anchor first,
Sailing beyond my beam's reach.

The new vessel, still restless,
Found no peace in an emptier harbor,
And soon set course for other horizons.

Now I stand on this concrete shore,
Keeper of an empty port,
Where only ghost ships dance in the moonlight,
And two sets of anchor marks
Scar the ocean floor.



#loss #jealousy #friendship #love #separation #regret #anchor #solitude
